messages.title: LOCAL RESIDENTS BACK LABOUR'S STEVE POUND
messages.content: Local residents in Greenford, Northolt, Perivale and Hanwell are backing Steve Pound to continue as our MP.

messages.title: Our children deserve a better future
messages.content: Children and young people in Ealing North rely on local schools to give them a good start in life.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Steve believes every local child should have the opportunity to go to a good local school. But the government has cut the funding to our schools, with some having to think about cutting teachers.
Steve will fight for additional funding for local schools so all our children have fair access to good teaching and facilities and get the chance to succeed in life.
Steve is fighting against government cuts that are making it hard for local families. It’s not just about funding but also about ensuring schools are properly funded and cuts to teachers are halted.

issues.education: Steve won new classrooms and facilities for schools in Greenford, Northolt, Perivale and Hanwell.
issues.government: The government has cut the funding to our schools.

community.content: Steve lives in Ealing North and understands the needs of the local community. He has championed the cause of the local hospital, fought government cuts to Ealing Hospital A&E and campaigned for more investment in Northwick Park Hospital.

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm very proud to live in Ealing North but we all know government cuts are making it hard for local families. This election is your chance to vote for a Labour MP who will put your community first.

politicalExperience.achievements: Worked tirelessly to win new classrooms and facilities for schools in Greenford, Northolt, Perivale and Hanwell.

quotes.text: I don't think it’s right that the government is cutting the funding to schools.

images.caption: Steve talks to local parents in Greenford about school funding cuts.
